short_summary: RFP for LPR and RFID Solution
full_summary:
#[RFP] for LPR and RFID Solution
===========================================

**Call Reference:** WS4643297477-Doc4667057834
**Publication Date:** July 3, 2024

**[Request for Proposal]:** Competitive - Open Bidding

**Description:** 

The Department of Public Works and Government Services invites submission of proposals for the provision of an LPR (License Plate Recognition) and RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) solution. This tender is open to all qualified and interested suppliers. The solution will be used by the Canada Border Services Agency to support border management and security.

**Key Dates:**

* **Tender Closing Date:** July 3, 2024 at 2:00 PM EST
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** June 28, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date:** [To be determined]

**Competition Overview:**

* **Type of Competition:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Trade Agreements:** The contract is subject to the following trade agreements:
  * Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
  * Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
  * Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
  * Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
  * Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
  * Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
  * Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
  * World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
  * Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
  * Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
  * Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
  * Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)

**Regions of Opportunity:** None

**Regions of Delivery:** 
* British Columbia
* Ontario (except NCR)
* Saskatchewan
* New Brunswick
* Manitoba
* Alberta
* Quebec (except NCR)

**Contact Information:**

* Name: Veronica Vallejo (SPAC/PSPC)
* Email: [veronica.vallejo@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:veronica.vallejo@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* Telephone: Not available

**Pre-Qualification:** Not applicable

**Evaluation Criterion:**

* Lowest Price

Note that some translation mistakes have been corrected. I also reformatted the entry into nicer markdown format but to meet the requirement of 400-word output,  I
